content.description:
An amazing pitch. Small crimps, ledges - fun footwork and a few exciting run outs make this a must do for the Arrow Climber at this difficulty. Not to be missed.  

  Hard for the grade.
content.location: Center route on the Dirty Wall

content.description: Hard crimping right off the ground on slippery rock (stick clip the first bolt) leads to varied climbing that can be a little tricky to read. Good fun adventure!
content.location: First route on the left side of the main Dirty Wall

content.description:
Third route from the Right when looking at the Dirty Wall. Recommended to stick clip the first bolt. 

  Negotiate some steep moves in slippery choss at the start making way quickly to bullet stone by the second clip.  Techy face climbing leads up to a bulge with a reachy move or 2. Then about 40-50 ft of 5.10 on blue rock to the chains. Excellent and varied. Fun!
content.location: Third from the Right on the Dirty Wall

content.description: Boulder off the ground with mail slot crimp into awesome sustained climbing.

The Dirty Wall is most often passed up on a climbers hike into the Swamp Cave, but one of these days you should drop your rope here and enjoy one of the best 5.12 walls in the South West. With outstanding rock quality, clean route (despite the name) and a nice variety of 5.12 you will definitely not be disappointed.
